content.question: Which of the following best describes the process by which the bacteria are breaking down the glucose to produce lactic acid?

choices.label: The bacteria are breaking down sugars in the absence of oxygen.

The bacteria are creating a <math alttext="H with a plus one charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> gradient to synthesize more <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The bacteria are using their mitochondria to break down glucose in the presence of oxygen.

The bacteria are producing <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in the Krebs cycle that is then converted into lactic acid.

content.answer: The bacteria are breaking down sugars in the absence of oxygen.
